title: The Writer's Almanac - Thursday, July 15, 2021
description: The first U.S. citizen to become a saint, Frances Xavier Cabrini, was born on this day in 1850  in Italy. She and her fellow Sisters aided the Italian immigrants of New York City.
itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
itunes:subtitle: The first U.S. citizen to become a saint, Frances Xavier Cabrini, was born on this day in 1850  in Italy. She and her fellow Sisters aided the Italian immigrants of New York City.
